Author: [TPUX] Djith Wattignies#3171
Content:
Question for contemplation.
First we know that crypto is in its infancy still..  lets say 3% of population are into crypto or heard about it.
How many do truely care about decentralised online platforms, currencies..?
If 100% of population knows about cryptocurrencies and how it works and how to use it..
How many would care enough ?

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: @[TPUX] Djith Wattignies   Different people will care about different things for different reasons.  More so they will care if it affects them.

Content: For instance imagine not being able to get a bank account .  The inner workings of the blockchain have little relevance to a persons need to store wealth .

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
@Spiderman  just in general platforms who provide projects/businesses a way to get started with blockchain tech.

The most established project would be of course Ethereum.

Zilliqa popped up with their focus on scalability: https://zilliqa.com/

Then Ontology sounds a bit like Komodo as they provide blockchains

> Ontology provides new high-performance public blockchains that include a series of complete distributed ledgers and smart contract systems.

> Ontology blockchain framework supports public blockchain systems and is able to customize different public blockchains for different applications.

There are quite a few platform focused projects out there, seems to have been a growing trend lately.
